tldr: This article discusses the potential threats to seabird populations from North Sea oil and gas developments. It examines the history of oil pollution incidents and the measures taken by the oil industry to minimize pollution risks. The article concludes that while there have been some accidents, the overall impact on seabird populations has been minimal, with breeding populations even increasing in some areas. The importance of maintaining high environmental standards and vigilance is emphasized.
